name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, the State of Michigan hit a big milestone in eradicating #COVID19. We have now officially administered 3 million shots of the safe and effective COVID-19 vaccines. We‚Äôre going to beat this thing together.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Additionally, beginning Monday, April 5, all Michiganders age 16+ who were not previously eligible will be eligible to receive a vaccine.  This is exciting news, and I urge all eligible Michiganders to get one of the three safe and effective COVID-19 vaccines.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, I ordered our flags to half-staff to honor and mourn the 500,000 American lives lost to COVID-19. As we grieve, we will continue to fight to eradicate #COVID19 entirely.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Thrilled that @DrKhaldun has been appointed to serve on White House COVID-19 Health Equity Task Force. Our entire country will benefit from her determination and expertise. Congratulations!

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Last year, I announced the Rebuilding Michigan bonding plan to fix the damn roads without an increase at the pump.   Even while combating COVID, we moved a lot of dirt. #MiSOTS21

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: @LtGovGilchrist chaired the Michigan COVID Task Force on Racial Disparities, focusing on education, testing and outreach that further saved lives.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: @DrKhaldun saw the disparate impact COVID was having on communities of color and we immediately took action. This not only saved lives in Michigan, but around the country as other states learned from us. #MiSOTS21

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: We‚Äôve lost over 14,000 Michiganders to COVID-19. 14,000 people with stories. With loved ones ‚Äì parents and siblings, children and friends.   I think about them every day. #MiSOTS21

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, I appointed Elizabeth Hertel as Director of @MichiganHHS. I am grateful to Director Gordon for his service, and excited to move forward with Director Hertel‚Äôs expertise and experience at the helm as we continue to work together to end the COVID-19 pandemic.  https://t.co/yWkRPr5qt9

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I was joined by @LtGovGilchrist and governors and lieutenant governors from Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Minnesota, Ohio, and Wisconsin to encourage everyone to make a plan for how you‚Äôll get the COVID-19 vaccine once eligible.  https://t.co/VSaxseNcJj

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: The Trump Administration has not only botched the rollout of the COVID-19 vaccine, but also misled the American people. After finally agreeing to release what remained of the federal vaccine reserve, we found out the truth ‚Äî there isn‚Äôt one.  https://t.co/2nRyV5wYlK

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: While this will provide families and businesses the support they need to stay afloat as we continue working to distribute the safe and effective vaccine and eliminate COVID-19, there is still more work to do.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: The relief bill includes $55 million to help small businesses impacted by COVID-19. Grants of up to $20,000 will be made available to small businesses across the state that need support this winter.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: This morning, history was made in Michigan. Millions of doses of Pfizer‚Äôs COVID-19 vaccine are now on their way to distribution centers across the country. I couldn‚Äôt be more proud of the extraordinary state we call home.  https://t.co/QBGdhBDsfz

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: The science is settled ‚Äî the best way to slow the spread is to double down on wearing masks, social distancing, and limiting indoor gatherings where people are most at risk to contract COVID-19.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Threats against our elected officials, no matter their party, are dangerous and unacceptable. This must stop. Now is the time to come together against our common enemy: COVID-19.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I am proud of the work the MI COVID-19 Racial Disparities Task Force to protect communities of color. But as COVID-19 cases continue to rise we must continue to work together to protect our families, front line heroes, and small business. #MaskUpMichigan

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: The COVID-19 pandemic has shown us the deep inequalities and disparities communities of color face every day. Today, @LtGovGilchrist and I announced the significant progress Michigan has made to slow the spread of the virus in these communities.  https://t.co/D5rnLIJQMo

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: With Thanksgiving around the corner, and as COVID-19 cases continue to rise, I wanted to take a moment to urge Michiganders everywhere to do your part to protect our families, our frontline workers, and our small businesses.  https://t.co/gMoD2At1Bo

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: For the 7th time in last 30 days, our top epidemiologists and public health experts hosted a covid data briefing & answered questions from legislators who made the time/chose to participate.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: THREAD: Today, I had calls on Michigan‚Äôs COVID hotspots & talked to other governors to coordinate our COVID-19 response.  https://t.co/bPdUFdnd9V

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I joined @GovAndyBeshear, @GovMikeDeWine, @GovEvers, @GovHolcomb, @GovPritzker, and @GovTimWalz to talk about protecting our families and frontliners from COVID-19 during the holidays. Mask up, we‚Äôre going to get through this together.  https://t.co/G1sZQGBOYp

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Governor Whitmer‚Äôs Statement on Pfizer Vaccine News and President-Elect Biden‚Äôs COVID-19 Response Team Announcement:  https://t.co/zqVa7vIA14

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: ‚ÄúFall and winter holidays will look different this year. But there is no need for despair. We are strong, we are smart, and we care about each other. Make the choice this fall to stop the spread of COVID-19. The life you save may be your own.‚Äù - @DrKhaldun  https://t.co/U9lk6frnv8

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: We are seeing an alarming rise in COVID-19 cases in Michigan right now. It is vital that we wear masks, avoid large gatherings, and practice physical distancing. Your fellow Michiganders and our frontline health care workers are counting on each one of us to do the right thing.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: This is why we took action. It worked. It‚Äôs also why we need you to do everything you can to slow the spread of COVID-19.  Practice social distancing. Wash your hands frequently. Mask up. We‚Äôve come too far to lose all of the progress we‚Äôve made.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: COVID-19 didn‚Äôt stop being a threat because of the court ruling, because we‚Äôre tired of it, or because the legislature left town. We all have to do our part, because when it comes to fighting this virus, we are all in this together.  https://t.co/5LQwXO9UYi

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I know this is hard. I know it will be an adjustment. But we can‚Äôt let our guard down. COVID-19 is still a real threat to our families and frontline workers. The virus doesn't care if you're rich or poor, a Republican or a Democrat, young or old. Let‚Äôs all be smart and stay safe.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, after a recent surge in COVID-19 cases in the Upper Peninsula, or MERC Region 8, I signed an Executive Order that moves the region back to phase 4 of the MI Safe Start Plan. The executive order will go into effect Friday, October 9 at 12:01am.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I am wishing the president and first lady a speedy recovery. COVID-19 is the most dangerous public health crisis America has faced in 100 years. It is still present in our communities. It is still spreading. And people are still dying from it every single day.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: It was great to check in with the @Hunt_Institute to discuss Michigan's support of children, families and childcare during the COVID-19 pandemic for @EarlyLearnNatn.  https://t.co/Y9750cY57A

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: It is time for the president and Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell to do the right thing and come to the table with congressional Democrats to negotiate a comprehensive relief package that meets the scale of the COVID-19 pandemic.  https://t.co/AnVCF4CDXM

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, I announced that we are launching Futures for Frontliners, the first program in the country offering tuition-free college to the Michiganders who provided frontline services during the COVID-19 Stay Home, Stay Safe orders between April - June 2020.  https://t.co/g6Y6qynxCk

tweet: If you‚Äôre a Michigander struggling to pay your utility bills during the COVID-19 pandemic, there is extra financial assistance available to you. Don‚Äôt wait to seek help, as the additional funding expires on Sept. 30th. Reach out today ‚û°Ô∏è  https://t.co/i7w6t7I8U8

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, we announced a $1.2M donation to Michigan‚Äôs COVID-19 Response and Recovery Initiative from @IKEAUSA, the largest donation to the fund to date. I‚Äôm extraordinarily grateful to IKEA for their generosity ‚Äî this donation will be crucial to providing support and saving lives.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, the Court of Appeals ruled to uphold the emergency powers given to governors to protect Michiganders from crises. I will continue to do what I said I would from day one: taking deliberate, measured actions to protect Michiganders from COVID-19. https://t.co/Yigm57yteQ

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I will continue to use every tool at my disposal to protect Michiganders from the spread of this virus. Please, wear a mask, practice safe physical distancing, and do everything in your power to fight COVID-19.  Read more:  https://t.co/21dDcNlCgn

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, I extended our Declaration of Emergency and reinstated protections for Michigan workers as we continue to fight the COVID-19 pandemic. It‚Äôs vital that employees know that they can stay home if they, or someone they‚Äôve been in contact with, is sick.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I had a great time getting my hands dirty (or clean!) at @americanfifth making hand sanitizer for businesses and people across Michigan! I am so grateful to see business like them stepping up to help fight COVID-19.  https://t.co/Vb9sS7dYf9

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Members of the National Guard have been vital to our fight against COVID-19, and our fight isn‚Äôt over yet. Today, I sent a letter to @realDonaldTrump requesting the help of the @MINationalGuard until the end of 2020. Their work will be essential to testing, distribution and more.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: By wearing masks, we can save lives and protect our family, friends, and neighbors from the spread of COVID-19. And by wearing masks now, we can put our state in a stronger position so our kids can return to school safely in the fall. Let‚Äôs #maskupmichigan

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Wanted to take a moment to wish you a happy Fourth of July weekend. As we celebrate, please remember that, while we might get to take a break, COVID-19 does not. For the sake of the extraordinary country we love and call home, be safe, be smart, and #RecreateResponsibly.  https://t.co/Kc5rKGP20J

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: After recent COVID-19 outbreaks tied to bars, we had to take action to slow the spread & keep people safe. If we want to be in a strong position to reopen schools for this fall, we must take aggressive action now to ensure we don‚Äôt wipe out all the progress we have made.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, I closed indoor service at bars throughout most of lower Michigan to protect the progress our state has made against COVID-19. I also signed bills that will allow cocktails-to-go at bars & restaurants to help these businesses serve more Michiganders.  Details ‚¨áÔ∏è

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: If we want to set our kids up for success this fall, we must do everything in our power to mitigate the spread of COVID-19, and that means wearing a mask. Take it from one of our state‚Äôs extraordinary educatorsüëá #MaskUpMichigan

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: What the upcoming school year will be like for our kids depends on each of us doing our part to flatten the COVID-19 curve. Please, continue to stay smart, stay safe, and take every recommended precaution so that our children can be safe in their classrooms this fall.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Our educators and parents have shown extraordinary leadership during the COVID-19 pandemic. While there are unknowns about the future of COVID-19 in Michigan, this plan provides the guidance, support, and clarity that is needed to safely bring students back to the classroom.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: BUDGET UPDATE: Today, the Senate Majority Leader, House Speaker, and I reached a bipartisan budget agreement that provides crucial funding for Michigan schools, families, & communities grappling with costs incurred as a result of COVID-19. name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Right now, despite having the 10th largest population, we have the 3rd highest COVID-19 deaths in the nation. I‚Äôm using every tool at my disposal to save lives, and it‚Äôs working. The curve is flattening.   Remember: COVID-19 is the enemy, not each other.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: I am so grateful for your partnership, @NYGovCuomo. The enemy isn‚Äôt each other, it‚Äôs COVID-19. We will get through this together.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: The President needs to do the right thing and issue a Presidential Declaration of Emergency in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. Lives are depending on it.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Tonight, I announced that in order to slow the spread of COVID-19 in Michigan, I am ordering the closure of all K-12 school buildings to students starting Monday, March 16 until Sunday, April 5. School buildings are scheduled to reopen on Monday, April 6.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: We also called on President Trump to allow for a special enrollment period under the ACA to allow more Americans, including Michiganders, to sign up for coverage and help mitigate the spread of COVID-19.

name: Governor Gretchen Whitmer
tweet: Today, I announced that we will expand access to telemedicine for Michiganders by immediately allowing Medicaid beneficiaries to receive services in their home while we fight the spread of COVID-19. We must do everything we can to ensure access to quality, affordable health care.
